current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
Permitting the use of the rotunda of the Capitol for a ceremony to award the Congressional Gold
			 Medal to the next of kin or personal representative of Raoul Wallenberg.

sponsor.#tail: submitted the following concurrent resolution; which was considered and agreed to

header.#text:
Use of rotunda for ceremony to award congressional gold medal to the next of kin or personal
			 representative of Raoul Wallenberg

text.#text:
The rotunda of the Capitol is authorized to be used on July 9, 2014, for a ceremony to award the
			 Congressional Gold Medal to the next of kin or personal representative of
			 Raoul Wallenberg in recognition of his achievements and heroic actions
			 during the Holocaust.

Physical preparations
			 for the ceremony described in subsection (a) shall be carried out in
			 accordance with such conditions
			 as the

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 SCON 36 ATS: Permitting the use of the rotunda of the Capitol for a ceremony to award the Congressional Gold Medal to the next of kin or personal representative of Raoul Wallenberg.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}rights.#text: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
